content: "Rigoletto" - Libretto Overview (Condensed to 650 Characters)Act 1: In the Duke’s palace, the womanizing Duke seduces Countess Ceprano. Rigoletto, his jester, mocks the courtiers, earning their hatred. Monterone curses Rigoletto after the Duke dishonors Monterone’s daughter. Rigoletto, haunted by the curse, secretly shelters his own daughter, Gilda, whom the Duke later seduces in disguise.Act 2: Gilda is abducted by courtiers, thinking she is Rigoletto’s lover. The Duke takes advantage of her.Act 3: Rigoletto plots revenge, hiring Sparafucile to kill the Duke. Gilda sacrifices herself to save the Duke. Rigoletto discovers her dying, fulfilling Monterone’s curse.
